column4: I have a question - have a stuck update, been hung for about an hour on setting up lirc (0.8.6-0ubuntu4.2) on 10.4 AMD 64bit  Not sure what to do.
open another terminal : sudo dpkg --clear-avail
response is dpkg: status database area is locked by another process
ok try , sudo fuser -vki /var/lib/dpkg/lock;sudo dpkg --configure -a
Blues
it is offering to kill the process...yes I guess?
yes

OK, looks like post processing in the terminal I opened and update manager went to a read meatball Update is complete...not all changes have been applied.  I had a lot of packages updating.  Should I re-run the update manager and un select the problem packag?
now open synaptic /edit/fix broken packages/ and if needed click apply ...this is a reduntant step but just want to make sure
what is the app/package you're trying to install ?
- Being prompted for a restart before I run synaptic.  Should I restat first or synaptic edit / fix broken packages first?
- it hung on updating LIRC
yes fix the broken pkges first
Thanks - trying now
I opened syanptic and clicked edit then fix broken packages and status line in bottom of window states "Successfully fixed dependancy problems"  Should I reboot now?
is the pakage manager rquirig a restart ?
or has the notification disappeared , vincentk ?
BluesKag - not the one I instantiated to run fix broke packages.  That restart dialog remains from my update attempt that we aborted earlier.
ok reboot
OK
so your reboot was successful , perhaps a different version of LIRC will work...does it require drivers?
gotta go

I have successfully rebooted and update manager reports my system is up to date.  I thank you for your knowledgeable support and assistance.  I am in technical support for NetApp and I know how challenging support can be. Thanks again
